title: System can be shut down without save file warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt files, shutting down Windows causes the loss of the changes in the .txt files.
EB: When shutting down Windows with opened, dirty .txt files, users should be prompted with a warning message to save their changes before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
1. Open WSWB.
2. Create a new project.
3. Create a text file in the project.
4. Add a line of text to the text file.
5. Observe that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
6. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer.
7. Observe that there is no warning or question message box to allow users to save their dirty file(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
